entry.title: Markdown
entry.content:
Markdown Cheat Sheet

Thanks for visiting The Markdown Guide!

This Markdown cheat sheet provides a quick overview of all the Markdown syntax elements. It canâ€™t cover every edge case, so if you need more information about any of these elements, refer to the reference guides for basic syntax and extended syntax.

Basic Syntax

These are the elements outlined in John Gruberâ€™s original design document. All Markdown applications support these elements.

Heading

H1

H2

H3

Bold

bold text

Italic

italicized text

Blockquote

blockquote

Ordered List

  1. First item
  2. Second item
  3. Third item

Unordered List

  • First item
  • Second item
  • Third item

Code

code

Horizontal Rule

Link

Markdown Guide

Image

Extended Syntax

These elements extend the basic syntax by adding additional features. Not all Markdown applications support these elements.

Table

Syntax Description
Header Title
Paragraph Text

Fenced Code Block

Footnote

Hereâ€™s a sentence with a footnote. [^1]

[^1]: This is the footnote.

Heading ID

My Great Heading

entry.title: Orientation
entry.content:
Orientation

Today is my Orientation day. Since Covid-19 pandemic, I've been waiting two years for commencing. Urvi Parikh is the orientation speecher who told us a lot of information about course and outcome in the future. I found out my classmate only one person. At least, I can start the course finally.

The picture above is my textbook, that scared me a lot. It's really thick one, it looks like it can kill someone.

entry.title: Load of Aussi
entry.content:
Aussi Expressions

  1. Are you kidding?
  2. As if!
  3. Thatâ€™s epic!
  4. No worries!
  5. Tough luck
  6. Catch ya(later)
  7. Sorry
  8. Whatâ€™s going on?
  9. Chugging along
  10. Iâ€™m wrecked
  11. Iâ€™m going to bail

1. Are you kidding?

Are you joking?
Are you serious?
For real?
Fair dinkum? (Slang)

2. As if!

To show disbelief, to show that you donâ€™t belief something is true, that you doubt something.

  • As if that would be the case
  • As if that is true

EX: As if I donâ€™t like chocolate. (å¥½åƒæˆ‘ä¸å–œæ­¡å·§å…‹åŠ›ä¸€æ¨£)

3. Thatâ€™s epic!

To show shock and superise that something is awesome, something is incredible.

  • Thatâ€™s awesome
  • That rocks
  • Thatâ€™s great
  • Thatâ€™s phenomenal
  • Thatâ€™s incredible

4. No worries!

  • Not to worry
  • Not a problem
  • All good
  • Thereâ€™s no issued
  • No wukkas (No fucking worries)(Slang)

5. Tough luck

  • Too bad
  • Deal with it
  • I donâ€™t care
  • What a shame

6. Catch ya(later)

  • Goodbye
  • See you later
  • See ya

7. Sorry

  • Pardon?
  • What did you say?
  • Could you please repeat that?

8. Whatâ€™s going on?

Whatâ€™s happening? Whatâ€™s your news? [^tip]

[^tip]: When we replay to greeting that start with â€œwhatâ€, the response is generally a negated response. ex: not much, not a lot, nothing.

  • Whatâ€™s going on with you?
  • Whatâ€™s going on in your life?
  • Whatâ€™s happening?
  • How have you been up to?
  • Sâ€™going on? (Slang)

9. Chugging along

Uesd to replay to the greeting, like â€œHow are you?â€, â€œHow are you going?â€, â€œHow are you doing?â€

It kind of like Iâ€™m continuing to do something in the same way as before.

10. Iâ€™m wrecked (Slang)

  • Iâ€™m stuffed
  • Iâ€™m cactus
  • Iâ€™m buggered
  • Iâ€™m fatigued
  • Iâ€™m tired

11. Iâ€™m going to bail

To bail means â€œto leaveâ€

  • Iâ€™m going to leave
  • Iâ€™mena bail (Slang)

12. Chuck a U-ey

Make a U-turn

  • Can I chuck a uey here?

13. Not here to Fuck Spiders

Stop wasting time or â€œnot here to fuck around. I am here to get the job doneâ€

  • â€œMate look at thisâ€ " Hey, we are not here to Fuck Spiders, get back to it."

entry.title: ã€PTEã€‘Describe Image
entry.content:
PTE å­¸ç¿’ç­†è¨˜ - DI

Task Type:

  • A bar graph / pie chart (1 or more or combination)
  • Table
  • Process / diagram
  • Flow chart
  • Map
  • Timetable
  • Floor plan
  • Photo
  • Venn diagram

How to describe a picture?

Try to find some factors from picture like sharp, colour, size and anything you see.

Template

  • 1
    The given image is about the topic of (Keyword 1) based on many different categories including (Keyword 2).

    Firstly, we see that (Keyword 3) can be a major point which is connected to (Keyword 4), so it is fair to say that it is important.

    However, (Keyword 5) can be an interesting aspect because of (Keyword 6).

    Finally, this is interesting because (Keyword 7) will continue to impact the future.

  • 2
    The given image is about interesting topics based on many different categories.

    Firstly, we see that the image can show a major point which is connected to our society, so it is fair to say that it is important.

    Finally, (Keywords 7~9).

PTE å­¸ç¿’ç­†è¨˜ - SST

entry.title: ã€PTEã€‘How to write Academicaly in PTE
entry.content:
PTE æŠ€å·§ - 7 ways academic writing

  1. Use no more than 1 or 2 personal pronouns
  2. Use a range of active and passive sentences
  3. Use modal verbs
  4. Use more formal, more precise words
  5. Use the noun form instead of the verb form
  6. Avoid contractions
  7. Use adverbs to â€˜hedgeâ€™ your ideas

Use no more than 1 or 2 personal pronouns

Personal pronouns: I, my, meâ€¦

Avoid personal pronouns where possible:
This essay will discuss three reasons whyâ€¦

NOTE: Using I or me once or twice is fine!

Use a range of active and passive sentences

Uses a mix of active and passive sentences.

Active: Governments should prohibit smoking in all outdoor areas.

Passive: Smoking should be prohibited in all outdoor areas.

Use modal verbs

Use might, could and wouldâ€¦

Example: Banning smoking in outdoor areas might deter people from smoking altogether.

Use more formal, more precise words

Uses less common but more precise words: Restricting smoking wouldâ€¦

Uses common words and phrasal verbs: Cutting back smoking willâ€¦

Use the noun form instead of the verb form

Noun Form: The prohibition of cigarettes would lead to a much healthier society.

Verb Form: If the government prohibited cigarettes, it would lead to a much healtier society.

Noun Form Verb Form
demonstration demonstrate
complaint complain
request ask
requirement need
recommondation recommond
suggestion suggest
invitation invit
development develop
wastage waste

Avoid contractions

Instead of writing â€œItâ€™dâ€ write â€œIt wouldâ€

Avoid contractions Use contractions
It is Itâ€™s
They are Theyâ€™re
Would not Wouldnâ€™t

Use adverbs to â€˜hedgeâ€™ your ideas

Uses adverbs to â€˜hedgeâ€™ language such as:

  • Probably
  • Possibly
  • Seemingly
  • Apparently
  • Arguably
  • Perhaps
  • Maybe
  • Presumably
  • Conceivably

Example: Banning smoking would probablyâ€¦

Uses informal adverbs to make language â€˜friendlierâ€™ such as:

  • very
  • really
  • pretty

Example: It was really funâ€¦

entry.title: ã€PTEã€‘Write from Dictation
entry.content:
PTE å­¸ç¿’ç­†è¨˜ - WFD

Facts

  • Number: 3-4 tasks
  • Scoring: Listening and Writing

Scoring

Donâ€™t MISSPELL, LEAVE OUT and REPLACE words

Tips

Write Both

If you are unsure which word is correct, then write both

Type the first letters of the words you hear

Example: The office is open on Friday and Saturday.

t o i o o f a s

Fast typing

Typing the note on the computer

Do not correct your typing mistake

Do not have time to correct.

Put the â€œa / theâ€ in front of nouns

Just in case, you wonâ€™t get penalised anyway.

entry.title: ã€PTEã€‘Write Essay
entry.content:
PTE å­¸ç¿’ç­†è¨˜ - WE

Template

The controversial topic concerning (noun/TOPIC) never fails to attract public attention. There has been a heated debate on whether (TOPIC/noun/singular) can provide benefits to our society or not. In this essay, I shall elaborate my point of view by analysing both sides of the argument before deducing a proper conclusion.

First of all, it is quite reasonable for me to believe that the idea of promoting (noun) provides several merits. The first point regards to the issue is that the benefits of (TOPIC) have contributed to the advancement of the subject; (2 examples/â€¦andâ€¦) would be convincing examples to name but a few. As a result, (TOPIC) can be beneficial for both old and new generations across the world.

In contrast, it is commonly known as the fact that (TOPIC) can be (benefit/harm) our (communities/?). Nevertheless, the statement does hold water to some extent. Moreover, it should be pointed out that there are various (concerns/advantages), such as (2 examples). Furthermore, these examples can be significant factors that ought to be considered.

In conclusion, due to the aforementioned reasons, we may safely conclude that the positive impacts of (TOPIC) far outweigh the drawbacks. Therefore, I strongly recommend keeping this trend in the future for soiceties to take careful steps to mitigate potential problems.

entry.title: Phone Interview
entry.content:
Preparation of the Phone Interview

1. (Introduce)Tell me a little bit about yourself

  • I graduated from (University) with a (bachelor degree) degree in (major) in (year)
  • I was in charge of (n, n and n)
  • I assisted withâ€¦
  • I was responsible forâ€¦
  • My duties includeâ€¦
  • I was in that job/position for (number) years. Then I had the opportunity to be the (supervisor) for (XXX) company.
  • Then I went on to be (position) for (XXX) company.

My name is Jerry. I have over 8 years of experience in the warehouse & logistic industry in Taiwan. My first career that is related to warehousing is as a warehouse assistant with lativ company. I was in charge of processing daily orders and unpacking shipping containers. I worked with them for over 3 years. After that, I went to Australia on a working holiday for a year. (All of my work on working holiday was related to agriculture, like harvesting fruits or packing vegetables) When I came back to Taiwan, I went on to be Warehouse Storeperson for HCT company. I was responsible for inventory management and Carrying out tasks with high-reach forklift. I was in that job for 4 years. Then I worked for the LF company for about 1.5 years. My duties in that company include delivery arrangement, operating high-reach forklift ,and operating RF scanner to pick orders. Besides, Iâ€™ve obtained the Australian High Risk Work Licence. I have the skills and qualities to match the job desrciption. Outside of work I keep myself fit and active. I will go to the gym or hiking in my free time.

2. (Accomplishment)What is the biggest accomplishment from these jobs?

  • After the (something you did or plan), we saw a (how many percetage) increase in (which things gets benefits)
  • Though the effort of our team, we successfully (did something)

When I was still working at HCT company, our team simplified the workflow for picking and packing orders. We optimized every step of the work. Then we saw a 12% increase in Order fulfillment rate.

3-1. (Weakness)What is your biggest weakness?

I think Iâ€™m good at planning. My motto is â€œworking smarter rather than harderâ€. When we were going to process the daily orders, the supervisor would discuss the process with me. Then we tried and got very good results, we saved a lot of effort and manpower.

3-2. (Weakness)What is your biggest weakness?

  • Iâ€™m too much of a perfertionist.
  • I have a hard time balancing work and life. I think I work too hard sometime.

Iâ€™m too much of a perfertionist. I have a hard time balancing work and life. I think I work too hard sometime.

4. (Why this company)What do you like about company?

  • When I was browsing your website, I really liked your career training program for your employees. I really like that you are care about your employeeâ€™s growth. That is really important to me.

When I was browsing your website, I really liked your companyâ€™s friendliness and tolerance for cultural diversity. I really like that you are care about your employeeâ€™s growth. That is really important to me.

5. (Why hire you)Why do you think youâ€™ll be a good candidate for this position?

(Discuss the job duties(1~3) they posted)

  • Like I said, I was in charge of (forklift) for (8) years. I can hit the ground running. I know a great deal about (warehousing). So based on all that, I think this position is right up my alley and I have a lot to offer to your company.

As I metioned before, I have experience of operating forklift for years. I can hit the ground running. I know a great deal about warehousing, like picking and packing orders, operating RF scanner. So based on all that, I think this position is right up my alley and I have a lot to offer to your company.

6. (Leaving previous JOB)Why are you leaving your current job/position?

  • Iâ€™ve had an amazing experience in this job. Iâ€™ve learned a lot. But I think Iâ€™m ready for the next step.Iâ€™m ready for a bigger challenge.

Iâ€™ve had an amazing experience in this job. Iâ€™ve learned a lot. But I would go to Australia to study, so I have to leave.

7. (Thanks)In the end of phone interview

  • Thank you so much for your call. I really apperciate you taking the time to interview me. Based on what Iâ€™ve heard, Iâ€™m really interested in this position and I think I have a lot to offer. I would be pleased to meet you in person to talk more. Have a great day!

entry.title: Interview
entry.content:
Interview Questions for forklift driver

This template is for forklift driver.

1. TELL US ABOUT YOURSELF

My name is [INSERT NAME] and thank you for giving me this opportunity today. I have
the skills and qualities to match the job description, and to perform highly in the
role. I have experience of working with other people; I am someone who is always
seeking to learn and develop, and I have the creativity to help your business grow
whilst offering excellent service to your customers. Outside of work I keep myself fit and active; I am a positive person who always embraces change, and I will always
take responsibility for my own professional development

Answer
My name is Jerry. I have experience in warehouse & logistic industry in Taiwan for years. My first career that is related to warehousing is as a warehouse assistant with lativ company.
I was in charge of handling daily orders and unpacking shipping containers. After that, I went to Australia on a working holiday for a year. When I came back to Taiwan, I went on to be Warehouse Storeperson for HCT company. I was responsible for inventory management and Carrying out tasks with high-reach forklift. I was in that job for 4 years. Then I went on to be Warehouse Storeperson for LF company. My duties include delivery arrangement, operating high-reach forklift ,and operating RF scanner to pick orders. Iâ€™ve obtained the Australian High Risk Work Licence as well. I have the skills and qualities to match the job desrciption. Outside of work I keep myself fit and active. I will go to the gym or hiking in my free time.

2. WHY DO YOU WANT THIS JOB?

I want this job because it is a role that I am very passionate about, and I see my long term career in this position. I also want this job because having researched your company you are clearly innovative, you support your employees in their work, and you are always striving to move forward and develop.

Answer
I want this job because it is a role that I am very passionate about, and I have a lot of experience in this position. I saw the advertise on the Indeed

3. HOW DID YOU HEAR ABOUT THIS POSITION?

I have held a keen interest in your company for several months now and I have been on
the lookout for this role to be advertised. To make sure I was notified as soon as the position was advertised, I kept a daily check on the local job boards.

Answer
I found this position on the Indeed.

4. WHAT ARE YOUR STRENGTHS?

My strengths include my ability to learn things very quickly, the fact that I am a
people personâ€™ which means I will always be a positive role model for your company
whilst dealing with your customers, and the fact that I see change as a positive thing and I will always embrace it for the better good of the company.

Answer
My strengths include my ability to learn things very quickly, also can work with a team.

5. WHATâ€™S YOUR BIGGEST WEAKNESS?

My biggest weakness is the fact that I donâ€™t yet have much experience in talking to
large groups of people. This is something I am very keen to improve on, so if any
opportunities were to arise in this position to gain experience in this area, I would
certainly want to take advantage of that.

Answer
Iâ€™m too much of a perfertionist. I have a hard time balancing work and life. I think I work too hard sometime. This is something I am very keen to improve on.

6. HOW WOULD YOU DEAL WITH A CONFLICT WITH A CO-WORKER?

I would deal with the conflict by seeing if I was doing anything to contribute to the
conflict before speaking to my co-worker in private to find an amicable way forward that we were both comfortable with. I would always put the needs of my team first and
try to overcome the conflict so we could quicklv move forward.

Answer
I would deal with the conflict by seeing if I was doing anything to contribute to the
conflict before speaking to my co-worker in private to find a friendly way forward that we were both happy with.

7. WHERE DO YOU SEE YOURSELF IN 5 YEARS?

I see myself hopefully working for your company either in the same role or having
gained advancement to a higher level. In 5 years, I would have also developed significantly and be seen as a trusted, reliable and productive member of the
company.

Answer

8. WHATâ€™S YOUR IDEAL WORK ENVIRONMENT?

My ideal work environment is positive, is one where everyone in the team seeks to
continually grow and improve, and where I would get to use my creative side to help
the business grow and develop.

Answer
My ideal work environment is positive, is one where everyone in the team seeks to
continually grow and improve.

9. WHAT EXPERIENCE DO YOU HAVE RELEVANT TO THIS ROLE?

I have experience of dealing with clients and customers in a manner that is
representative of the companyâ€™s vision. I have experience of collaborating with other
people in a team to achieve a common objective, and I also have experience of solving problems independently, and completing time sensitive tasks under pressure.

Answer
As I mentioned before, I have experience of operating forklift for 5 years. I also have experience in picking and packing vegetables and fruits when I was on a Working holiday in 2013.

10. HOW WOULD OTHER PEOPLE DESCRIBE YOU?

My friends and previous co-workers have often described me as someone who is
driven, enthusiastic and upbeat. I believe they would also describe me as someone
they could turn to whenever they needed assistance; someone they could rely on to
help them out at short notice, and someone who has a can-do attitude and that takes
ownership of difficult situations.

Answer

11. DESCRIBE YOURSELF IN 3 WORDS.

I would describe myself as productive, commercially-aware, and self-motivated. I
am productive which means you will always see me achieving good things for the
business. I am commercially-aware which means I understand the importance of
always doing a good job on time to help the business thrive. I am also self-motivated
which means I will take it upon myself to quickly and diligently work through all tasks and duties to help the team achieve its objectives.

Answer
I would describe myself as positive, optimistic, and self-motivated.

12. WHATâ€™S BEEN YOUR GREATEST ACHIEVEMENT?

My greatest achievement was in my previous role where I helped the company
increase sales. This was achieved by improving customer service standards and
by thinking of different ways to help the business market its products via social
media.

Answer
When I was still working at HCT company, our team simplified the workflow for picking and packing orders. We optimized every step of the work. Then we saw a 12% increase in Order fulfillment rate.

13. WHAT DO YOU DO OUTSIDE OF WORK?

Outside of work I keep myself fit and active and I visit the gym a few times a week. This keeps me motivated and it also helps to boost my concentration levels at work. I am also a family person, and I often spend time at weekends with those closest to me. Finally, I like to read self-development books and I always have a good book on
the go at any one time.

Answer

14. WHAT CAN YOU DO FOR US THAT OTHER CANDIDATES CANâ€™T? (hard)

I can bring a diverse set of skills, qualities and experience to the team that I believe will help your business grow. I am a strong communicator, and I will always try to solve problems without troubling my manager. I will always take care of your customers which in turn will increase sales. I can also bring a level of knowledge to this role that I believe is unrivalled, and I will always work hard to ensure you see a positive return on vour investment by hiring me.

Answer
Like I said, I have experience of operating forklift for years. I can hit the ground running. I know a great deal about warehousing, like picking and packing orders, operating RF scanner. So based on all that, I think this position is right up my alley and I have a lot to offer to your company.

15. WHY DO YOU WANT TO WORK FOR US?

I want to work for your company because you are socially responsible, you have a
strong set of workplace values that align with my own ambitions and aspirations, and
you have a brilliant track record of achievement. If I am successful, I can
genuinely see myself working for your company for many years to come.

Answer

16. HOW WOULD YOU DEAL WITH A DIFFICULT CUSTOMER?

I would listen to the customer; I would ask them questions to establish their needs,
and I would try to establish a connection. At all times I would be professional, and I would try to find a solution to their problem quickly and calmly. It would be my goal to keep the customer onboard and to ensure they had a good experience with the
company.

Answer
I would listen to the customer; I would ask them questions to establish their needs,
and I would try to establish a connection. I would try to find a solution to their problem quickly and calmly.

17. TELL ME ABOUT A TIME WHEN YOU FAILED. (difficult)

In my last job I was working as part of a team that failed to finish a project on time. We simply failed because we had not listened to the brief fully at the start of the project, and things got missed. As soon as we realized we had made a mistake, we informed our manager, we apologized and we discussed what we had learned from
the experience to make sure it never happened again.

Answer
In my last job I was working as part of a team that failed to finish a project on time. We simply failed because we had not listened to the brief fully at the start of the project, and things got missed. As soon as we realized we had made a mistake, we informed our manager, we apologized and we discussed what we had learned from
the experience to make sure it never happened again.

18. WHY DO YOU WANT TO LEAVE YOUR CURRENT JOB?

I want to leave my job because I am seeking a fresh challenge with
an exciting and innovative company such as yours that has ambitious
plans for the future.

Answer

19. WHY SHOULD WE HIRE YOU?

I believe you should hire me because I am a very fast learner and I need little
supervision moving forward. I also believe you should hire me because I will represent your business positively, and I will treat your customers well. I will also ensure I find ways to help the business grow, whilst also helping you to save money by using resources in a frugal and responsible manner.

Answer
I believe you should hire me because I am a very fast learner and I need little
supervision moving forward.

20. WHAT DID YOU DISLIKE ABOUT YOUR PREVIOUS JOB?

There was only one thing that frustrated me slightly about my last job, and that was the fact that I felt we could have achieved so much more as a company. There were lots of opportunities in the market for us to expand and grow, but the company owners
seemed satisfied with where the company was at.

Answer
There was only one thing that frustrated me slightly about my last job, and that was the fact that I felt we could have achieved so much more as a company. There were lots of opportunities in the market for us to expand and grow, but the company owners
seemed satisfied with where the company was at.

21. DO YOU HAVE ANY QUESTIONS FOR US?

Thank you. I have just 3 questions, please.
Q. What would you need me to concentrate on in the first 30 days of starting?
Q. What are the plans for the company over the next 5 years?
Q. How has the position evolved over the years?
Q. What is the day-to-day work of this position?
Q. Does this position have penalty rate?

entry.title: ã€T1-WRITTINGã€‘Internet Users as Percentage of Population
entry.content:
Internet Users as Percentage of Population

The line graph compares the percentage of people in three countries who used the internet between 1999 and 2009.

It is clear that the proportion of population who used the internet increased in each countries over the period shown. Overall, a much larger percentage of Canadians and Americans had access to the internet in comparison with Maxicans, Canada experienced the fastest growth in internet usage.

In 1999, the proportion of people using the ineternet in USA was about 20%. The figures for Canada and Mexico were lower, at about 10% and 5% respectively. In 2005, the internet usage in both the USA and Canada rose to around 70% of the population, while the figure for Mexcio reached just over 25%.

By 2009, the percentage of internet users was highest in Canada. Almost 100% of Canadians used the internet, compared to about 80% of Americans and only 40% of Mexicans.

entry.title: ã€T1-WRITTINGã€‘UK acid rain emissions
entry.content:
UK acid rain emissions

The line graph compares four sectors in terms of the amount of acid rain emissions that they produced over a period of 17 years.

It is clear that the total amount of acid rain emissions in the UK fell considerably between 1990 and 2007. The most dramatic decrease was seen in the electricity, gas and water supply sector.

In 1990, around 3.3 million tonnes came from the electricty, gas and water supply sector. The transport and communication sector was responsible for about 0.7 million tonnes of emissions, while the domestic sector produced around 0.6 million tonnes. Just over 2 million tonnes of acid rain gases came form other industries.

Emissions from electricity, gas and water supply fell dramatically to only 0.5 million tonnes in 2007, a drop of almost 3 million tonnes. While acid rain gases from the domestic sector and other industries fell gradually, the transport and communication sector saw a small increase in emissions, reaching a peak of 1 million tonnes in 2005.
